Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: skyharbo
Reviews.Content: i read all the reviews before i left, it was even better than i imagined. i was there for 6 days on business. nice rooms, 2 seperate areas, living room- kitchen with fold out bed, and bedroom with bathroom, both with nice tv's. plates, silverware, coffee, tea, micro popcorn, salt, pepper, cream, sugar. breakfast and light dinner were very good, and the price was right, free! the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Inklette
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business. I have stayed here before, but since my last stay the rooms and lobby have been updated. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast and dinner with wine and beer make this place a bargain. Great location if you are visiting the market center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property!”
Reviews.Author: FoxyDerick
Reviews.Content: Below are my ratings for this property on a scale of 1-5: Hotel Location 4 Hotel Lobby 5 Hotel Restaurant/Breakfast 5 Hotel Customer Svc 5 Room Size 5 Room Carpet 5 Bathroom 5 Cleanliness 5 Cost/Value 5 DÃ©cor 5 Average 4.90

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: maze916
Reviews.Content: This hotel recently renovated good location and services.

Reviews.Title: “After tens years they shut us out.”
Reviews.Author: FRANKFONTI
Reviews.Content: I've booked a block of for the June and January markets for myself and associates for the past ten years. This year I've called 2 or 3 times and e-mailed 2 times to try to get the rooms as in the past. I was told there was new Sales Management in place and they would get back to me. We always enjoyed staying there because the staff was so good to us. However, I have decided that we are no longer valued as a customer since no one has responded to my request. Therefore we will be going somewhere else in January for market.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for business travelers!”
Reviews.Author: Txtraveler1836
Reviews.Content: This is a nice homewood. The room I was in looked remodeled from the photos currently posted. Nice location for downtown and market business. Beer and wine at night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: timolad
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because they had apt style rooms with 2 beds and a sofa sleeper. Very pleasant surprise when we actually saw the room. Plenty of room, 2 full baths, and a full kitchen. Only drawback was the first floor of the apt was on the 2nd floor of the bldg with no elevator (3 50+ women had to carry our luggage up the stairs). Complimentary breakfast was good. Front desk staff were mostly friendly and very helpful with things to do and places to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, until the morning we left.”
Reviews.Author: MountainMel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was mostly great until the morning we left. Hotel room was clean enough (the bathtub had some hair in it). We had a kitchinette that we didn't know about which was nice. And the front desk staff were awesome! Remembered my name, always helpful, etc. The are isn't great. You can't really walk anywhere as it is surrounded by freeways/highways. The breakfast was pretty awesome for something that comes with your stay. The fitneed center was minimal on equipment. Also, if you fly in the larger airport in Dallas the cab right is a little expensive and takes about 15-20 minutes. The bad news... The water was a little tempermental the whole time. It is hard to find the right temperature. But the morning we left, when we had to get up at 4:00am and things were already unpleasant we ended with no hot water. I think this might have ruined the stay for me. Because the water was touchy the whole time I am going to assume this wan't a one time thing. So there you have it. I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone because of the water issue, which is a huge issue to me. For business, especially at the Dallas Market Center, this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: roxiekay
Reviews.Content: The rooms were roomy and clean, the only negative was the bedcover was worn. The swimming pool and gym were nice and clean. The personal TV for each treadmill (with ear phones) was a good option. The breakfast and dinner were fresh with a nice selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites”
Reviews.Author: AsiaSue
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Homewood Suites for business trip. Front desk staff pleasant and courteous. As with all the Homewood Suites, breakfast and evening reception were great with appropriate foods. Room overall was spacious and clean. Nice to have separate living and sleeping areas. Only drawbacks were that the air conditioning unit was a bit noisy and internet was difficult to connect. No major or minor complaints. Will definately seek Homewood Suites when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - avoid rooms fronting on the interstate”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: This hotel frequently has very competitive room rates, and offers perfectly acceptable accommodations. Access is a little tricky from the south, as you have to do a U-turn under I-35 and come back to the hotel, and the parking lot entrance is easy to miss. Only other piece of advice is to ask for a room toward the rear of the building - the rooms at the front face I-35 and traffic is audible all night, even on the upper floors. It didn't bother my college-aged kid, but it bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Exceeded My Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: 2kidshouston
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel, and I was a little apprehensive since we usually stay at the 4-5 Start Hiltons. I was EXTREMELY PLEASED and would totally stay there again. The breakfast was great, room great, and they were totally nice to my 2 little boys. The staff was unbelieveably responsive. They all had their A game on. The shuttle took us several places, and we played games in the dining area infront of the fireplace. They really had the "home" theme going in a clean and professional manner. They really went above and beyond. I have been converted to a big fan! Great for famlies, business, extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “After 2 years of bi-weekly trips to Dallas, this is my favorite 2nd home!”
Reviews.Author: diaperchanger01
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this location for some time now. First, the staff at this location is incredible. The front desk clerks know us by names, know our situation, and does everything they can to accomadate our needs. The double rooms are very roomy for the price. The free hot breakfast is wonderful as is the dinner. The business center has always been an asset to us since we are gone from home for such long periods. I cannot say enough about this property because the staff has made us feel at home. We travel so much, but this is where we feel closest to our own home.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Quiet, Clean, Met and Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: happywifeinOKC
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff HUGE hot breakfast with more food than you could think of eating or drinking, kept fully stocked and clean Free shuttle to downtown area Room is huge for price Sheets and towels were so soft and bed was very comfortable Room was perfect upon check in Other guests even long term guests commented that it is one of the best because of the staff / management They even grocery shop for you They have security cameras in parking lot - not sure if they are decoys or working but they're there - also all lights are working in parking lot I read a review o n here that was annyoing from one guest that trashed this hotel because his vehicle was broken into within three days of his stay here. I say this is annoying because Dallas is known to have the highest break ins of major cities. I also want to point out that last year my husband and I stayed in a 5 star hotel downtown Dallas which was extremely expensive and known as one of the nicest hotels and our vehicle, along with 15 others were broken into on the first night we checked in. You can't blame a hotel for this, it is how they respond to this that is important. We didn't blame the hotel or ask for anything and we didn't write a bad review. Upon looking into that reviewers past reviews, it looks like he is a very critical and negative person anyway, leaving bad reviews all over the place and not nice ones. It's almost like a hidden hotel line that I'm excited we found. I saw huge dogs here but no dog poop anywhere. Smiles and friendly staff everywhere. Bottom line, this was a great hotel, I would stay here again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Better Then I Expected”
Reviews.Author: TLBowman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for only a couple of days and it was actually very nice. I was in room 202. The rooms are huge! The rooms were quiet and clean. The breakfast was very nice. Not as good as Embassy Suites (where I tend to stay), but good none the less. The evening desk clerk was so friendly and polite. The hotel is located not far from "resturant row", which offers a pretty decent selection of mid-priced places to eat. Its also not very far from the down town area. There is a Whataburger adjacent to it, if you just want a burger.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: La_bounder
Reviews.Content: We completely enjoyed this hotel. Everyone working at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The people working the front desk looked up local information for me several times. The complimentary breakfast was very good. The evening light meal was very pleasant. We had the shuttle bring us to the Museum for the Tut exhibit and pick us up later elsewhere in town. That was very nice since we did not have to find our way around the area and construction (everywhere!) This hotel provides so much more than other hotels for the same price. Not a lot to do around the area (for tourists) but no homeless hanging around like downtown hotels, which I have read about on this website. I found the room very clean and nice, the beds very comfortable. We were even upgraded to a nicer suite when ours was still dirty when we arrived. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE111111111111111111”
Reviews.Author: lulu250
Reviews.Content: If staying for Market, be prepared to "loose your room" even if it is verified by a credit card. I arrived at 6"15pm and was told my reservation had been "walked" or canceled. Five other parties lost their rooms too. Also one lucky person came back to the desk complaining of NOT getting the rooms they requested,

Reviews.Title: “worst Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: abst14
Reviews.Content: I am a HIlton fan so I was terribly disappointed with this property. The location was not good. I arrived late and tried to stop at a few gas stations, fast food restaurants to pick up something to eat but couldn't get out of the car. I'm pretty brave when traveling but the location didn't feel safe. At the front desk the clerk told me not to go to these spots at night. I was starving. I had to buy something from the hotel cooler. The hotel was old and smelly. I depend on the computers at Hilton properties for last minute work and the two machines didn't have internet connection. The front desk clerk in the morning insisted it was working because the screen would come up but she didn't try to go onto the internet. Her attitude was "oh well" When I pressed her to find out if she was going to report it, she said it was the first time she heard of the problem. Was she going to report it, Yes, and when I asked how long she anticipated for someone to look at it her response was I had to wait a couple of days. I then asked her to check if the computers were working at the Hilton property down the street and she said she didn't think they had computers. I insisted she call and of course they did. I wanted to check out and move to another location but I would have lost my deposit. Unless you have busines at market place or the nearby hospitals avoid this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Leilani07
Reviews.Content: This Homewood Suites is average Homewood. I have stayed at this location 4 times (about a week each) due to price. The rooms are typical homewood room. The double beds room have better beds than king size room. Hampton has better beds than homewood. The best thing of this hotel is the breakfast time. The chef there makes the best muffins. I believed they're homemade. The manager reception was good enough and they always replenish it until ended. There's whataburger next door and that's about it. Very close to Southwestern Medical Center and other hospitals (Parkland and Children MC). I may stay at this place again if they can give me good rates otherwise i'll chose other Homewood Suites around Dallas area that is close to restaurants and shopping area. Overal they were good stays.

Reviews.Title: “Meets Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: This is what you would expect from a Homewood Suites. The rooms are comfortable and designed for extended stay guests. The beds are not as comfortable as you will find in Hilton Garden Inns or some Hampton Inns. The rooms are functional, with kitchenetts, fridge etc. The downside is they are not set up for strictly business travelers. Work desk is functional, but not at all comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed at Homewood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Dallas on business and needed a place to stay off and on for three months. Within the first 3 days, my vehicle had been broken into and the stereo stolen out of the dash. By the end of the second week, a collegue of mine had the same thing happen. By talking to other guest we learned of two other incidents where guest's belongings had been taken. Neither of our cars were flashy, or drew attention and this still happened too often for a Hilton family hotel. I would not reccommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that this was a Hilton property--the rooms were a bit rundown and had some problems. There was no covering over the overhead light in the bathroom. There was no fan in the bathroom, so it would get very stuffy after someone took a shower. The shower/tub had mildew stains in the corners. When we turned the heat on, the smoke detector went off, so we had to turn it off. The carpet was frayed. There were initially no washcloths in our room, and the front desk didn't have any (although cleaning service did provide some after they cleaned the room the next day). The rooms and hallways smelled musty and stale. There were rat poison traps stacked up outside the side entrance to the hotel. Yuck. The "business center," if you can call it that, was less than adequate. No pens/paper were provided and the computer (there was only one) was VERY slow. Oddly, they did provide an atlas and a typewriter. On the plus side, the breakfast in the morning was quite adequate and the lobby was kept very clean. The curtains in the rooms really kept the room dark, which was also nice. I will probably not stay here again, as there are definitely better properties for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stale, stuffy rooms. Carpet is frayed. Hotel roms need major overhaul... Lobby is kept VERY clean, but rooms are old and neglected. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: maenoda
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay with them! They have food and drinks Monday-Thursday which was outstanding because after a long trip of traveling we didn't feel like going out to dinner. They also had room for our kids to run around in the back by the pool which was extremly nice since you didn't have to worry about the traffic or pool (it was fence in). In the morning they had a hot breakfast and it was much better than cold donut that I have seen at other hotels. Also, real easy to get around town to all the sites and back to your hotel. We would most definely stay at this hotel again for the price, location and food!

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Dallas-Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2747 North Stemmans Freeway, Dallas, TX 75207
